examples: There's a lot of admin involved in the birth of a child.

entries.meaning: (countable, informal) An administration (a body that administers; the executive part of government).
(countable, informal) An administrator (one who administers affairs).
(countable, informal, computing) A systems administrator (one who maintains a computer system or network).
examples: Our admin has upgraded the server in our office, so we can exchange files faster.

entries.meaning: (countable, informal, Internet) A user of a discussion forum, website, etc. with privileges allowing them to control or restrict the activity of other users.
examples: The admin changed the forum settings to enable the use of emoticons.

verbs.description: admin (third-person singular simple present admins, present participle admining or adminning, simple past and past participle admined or adminned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing, informal) To serve as an administrator for or of.
